immune.note: from nonmagical attacks that aren't adamantine

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The oaken bolter is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The oaken bolter has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Fleshcutter
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit +6} to hit, range 100/400 ft., one creature. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d10 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Armor-piercing Bolt
entries: The oaken bolter launches a heavy missile at a target within 100 feet. The target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw or take 9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Harpoon
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit +6} to hit, range 50/200 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) piercing damage and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 11}). While {@condition grappled} this way, a creature's speed is not reduced, but it can move only in directions that bring it closer to the oaken bolter. A creature that tries to escape from the grapple takes an additional 5 ({@damage 1d10}) slashing damage, regardless of whether the attempt succeeds or fails. As a bonus action, the oaken bolter can pull a {@condition grappled} creature 20 feet closer to itself. The oaken bolter can grapple only one creature at a time.

action.name: Explosive Bolt {@recharge 5}
entries: The oaken bolter launches an explosive charge at a point within 100 feet of itself. Every creature within 20 feet of the target point takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) fire damage plus 14 ({@damage 4d6}) force damage. Both damages are halved with a successful {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw.

This is no ordinary ballista but a semi-intelligent construct capable of striking at long distances. The bolts it launches can rend flesh, destroy armor, drag enemies toward traps or melee-oriented clockwork.

If the Oaken Bolter is destroyed, these effects fade over the course of 1d10 days.
